required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preventing Preterm Birth With a Pessary
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Preterm Birth With a Pessary

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study, is to determine the effect of a Cup pessary, a device that is currently readily available in the USA and similar in design to the Arabin pessary, on the incidence of delivery prior to 37 weeks in women with a history of prior spontaneous birth (before 37 weeks) and incidentally found to have a cervix less than 25 mm in length prior to 23 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: delivery prior to 37 weeks of gestation
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 30 days after delivery of the neonate
primary_outcome.description: Gestational age at birth will be recorded

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of birth less than seven days from randomization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 30 days after delivery of the neonate
secondary_outcome.description: Gestational age at birth will be recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 30 days after delivery of the neonate
secondary_outcome.description: Gestational age at birth will be recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: defined as either a stillbirth or postnatal death prior to hospital discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 30 days after delivery of the neonate
secondary_outcome.description: Birthweight at delivery will be recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: intraventricular hemorrhage, respiratory distress syndrome of the newborn, retinopathy of prematurity, or necrotizing enterocolitis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: ventilation, phototherapy, treatment for sepsis, blood transfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of complications due to pessary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 4 weeks while pregnant with pessary in situ
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of bacterial vaginosis, urinary tract infections, vaginal erosions will be recorded at monthly visits.

arm_group.description: Expectant Management + weekly intramuscular progesterone injections

intervention.description: Placement of cup pessary in the vagina after randomization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancies in patients with a history of spontaneous preterm birth (previous delivery between 17 0/7 weeks and 36 6/7 weeks).
- Women ages 18 to 45 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major fetal abnormalities (defined as those that are lethal or require prenatal or postnatal surgery), fetal death, or fetal growth restriction diagnosed before randomization.
- Presence of prophylactic cervical cerclage
- Significant maternal-fetal complications (treated chronic hypertension, insulin dependant diabetes mellitus, red cell isoimmunization)
- Painful regular uterine contractions, or ruptured membranes
- Visual cervical dilation of 2cm or greater and visible membranes.
- Patients with a pregnancy dated by an ultrasound after 20 weeks gestation.
